intro: Critoniopsis heydeana, commonly known as the Cape goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It has small, narrow leaves and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its hardiness and attractive appearance. Critoniopsis heydeana is also valued for its ability to thrive in coastal environments with minimal water requirements.
